title: What do you think is the most Balanced Champion in the Game?
body:
http://ddragon.leagueoflegends.com/cdn/img/champion/splash/MonkeyKing_5.jpg

We on the boards read about 10,000 times a day that this champion or that champion is broken or gutted and needs to be nerfed or buffed....

But I want to hear what the boards think is the most balanced champion right now.

Personally I think Wukong is in a great state right now, been a relatively powerful sleeper pick that can teamfight and duel ,but does have a reasonable amount of counter play. 


Thoughts? What is your pick?

So far, there has only been one support mentioned (with the slight exception of Vel'koz).

So, I'm going to say Nami. Yeah, yeah, she's a redemption abuser, but that's the item, not the champ. She has very clear strengths and weaknesses, her skillshots can be dodged easily enough, she does her job EXTREMELY well while not feeling overbearing, and has just the right amount of variance in her kit to compliment different playstyles. She is also quite easy to play, but has a high enough skill ceiling to where you can pick out the good from the great Nami players.

I'd even go as far as saying that she is the best designed support in the game.

Wukong has always been strong, and I feel that the only reason he hasn't been nerfed is simply because there are always extremes that he's compared to. Like Riven or Pantheon.

{{champion:78}} {{champion:68}} {{champion:136}} {{champion:15}} Have all been pretty stable and all things considered are relatively balanced.
Sol has been exploiting Crystal Scepter, but that's not his fault, it's the item's.

Poppy is too safe. She can feed and still be impossible to kill with respectable damage. She's a surprisingly good duelist as well. I think she's a bit overtuned, and that is part of why she was picked at worlds so much.
A. Sol is incredibley strong, but also has many avenues of counterplay--it's just that his strengths honestly trump those avenues if he's in the right hands.  For a player who is skilled at prediction and positioning, there are really almost no unfavorable matches for an ASol. Combine with playmaking ability and map awareness, this guy is incredibley understated.
Rumble is a meta slave champion who has to undergo cycles of being allowed to be strong, and being forced to be mediocre.

I think {{champion:61}} and {{champion:14}} are perfect balance wise. They can be played somewhat effectively by a first timer but players more experienced with the champion can do a lot more.

Oddly enough they are my 2 favorite champions at the moment. IDK, I just love their skill curves.

{{champion:78}} She does what she's meant to do, she isn't completely oppressive in lane, you can position yourself to be safe from her, even if she builds large amounts of ad she can't delete you immediately, leaving her open to retaliation, she's consistently tanky and useful, her W was meant to counter dash yet doesn't last too long, she peels effectively, her ult(and whole kit) is a perfect example of how skill should be rewarded, and at the end of the day she isn't impossible to deal with, just hard to, like a tank should.
